meanings.definition: To search with the hands in a hasty or clumsy way
meanings.sent1: She had to grabble in her bag to find her keys.
meanings.sent2: The child tried to grabble for the toy hidden in the box.
meanings.sent3: As she grabbled for her phone, it slipped further into the couch cushions.
meanings.sent4: In the dark room, his hands grabbled for the light switch.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to grabble for the right spice among the many jars.

meanings.definition: To grope or feel around with the hands
meanings.sent1: He would grabble in the dark to find his way out of the cave.
meanings.sent2: The blindfolded person had to grabble to identify objects by touch.
meanings.sent3: The cat would grabble at the yarn, thinking it was a mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers grabbled for the right thread in the sewing kit.
meanings.sent5: The child's hands grabbled for the hidden candy in the jar.

meanings.definition: To scramble or struggle to obtain something
meanings.sent1: The competitors grabbled to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: She had to grabble with the lock to open the door.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel would grabble with the nut to carry it up the tree.
meanings.sent4: The students grabbled for the last piece of cake at the party.
meanings.sent5: The workers grabbled to finish the project before the deadline.

meanings.definition: To fish with the hands by groping underwater
meanings.sent1: The children would grabble in the shallow stream for tadpoles.
meanings.sent2: He would grabble in the pond to catch the slippery fish.
meanings.sent3: The otter would grabble for clams at the bottom of the river.
meanings.sent4: The diver had to grabble for the lost treasure in the sunken ship.
meanings.sent5: The boy loved to grabble for seashells along the sandy beach.
